renderer::Primitive

renderer::Primitive Namespace Reference

The type of primitives for rendering.


Enumerations

enum  {
  POINTS, LINES, LINES_ADJACENCY, LINE_STRIP,
  LINE_STRIP_ADJACENCY, LINES_LOOP, TRIANGLES, TRIANGLES_ADJACENCY,
  TRIANGLE_STRIP, TRIANGLE_STRIP_ADJACENCY, TRIANGLE_FAN, QUADS,
  QUAD_STRIP, POLYGON
}

Enumeration Type Documentation

anonymous enum

Enumerator:
POINTS  Each vertex is treated as a single point.
LINES  The two successive vertices are treated as line endings.
LINES_ADJACENCY  Same as above, but with information for adjacent vertices. (See SM 4.0 primitives information for details).
LINE_STRIP  Successive vertices are connected with lines.
LINE_STRIP_ADJACENCY  Same as above, but with information for adjacent vertices. (See SM 4.0 primitives information for details).
LINES_LOOP  Successive verticies are connected with lines. Last vertex is connect with first.
TRIANGLES  Vertices triplets are used to create triangle.
TRIANGLES_ADJACENCY  Same as above, but with information for adjacent vertices. (See SM 4.0 primitives information for details).
TRIANGLE_STRIP  Triangles are constructed as following (with correction for bypass direction) (1,2,3),(2,3,4),(3,4,5)...
TRIANGLE_STRIP_ADJACENCY  Same as above, but with information for adjacent vertices. (See SM 4.0 primitives information for details).
TRIANGLE_FAN  Triangles are constructed as following (with correction for bypass direction) (1,2,3),(1,3,4),(1,4,5)...
QUADS  Four successive vertices are treated as a convex quad edges.
QUAD_STRIP  Four successive vertices are treated as a convex quad edges in following way (with correction for bypass direction) (1,2,3,4),(2,3,4,5)...
POLYGON  Successive vertices are treadented as convex polygon edges.
